newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on Thursday on interbank and retail interest, dealers said.

"The interbank rate slipped slightly today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were steady to easier but bond prices were narrowly mixed. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 1.20/1.15 percent compared with Wednesday's yield of 1.22/1.17 percent but one-year was unchanged from Wednesday's yield of 1.31/1.26 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$99.54/99.59 against Wednesday's close of S$99.55/99.60, March 2001 at S$99.70/99.75 from S$99.73/99.78 and June 2003 at S$99.53/99.58 versus S$99.52/99.57.
The overnight interbank offered rate slipped to 3-3/4 3-5/8 percent against Wednesday's 3-7/8 3-3/4 percent.
